Class WebRequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • WebRequestHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler

    public class WebRequestHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler
    The WebRequestHandler is responsible for handling and parsing requests from the user interface and calling the appropriate methods in the MainController.
    Author:
    Shawn Koop

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private MainController mainController
      The main controller of the automation system whose requests are handled by this WebRequestHandler.
      private java.lang.String pluginsFolder
      A String that contains the path to the folder containing peripheral descriptors

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WebRequestHandler(MainController mainController)
      Create a new WebRequestHandler to handle user interface requests for the MainController of the automation system.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void destroySID(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange)
      This method destroys the session ID of an HTTP request by parsing the cookie containing the session ID and calling the destroySID method in the mainController.
      private void downloadDescriptor(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange)
      This method parses an HTTP request body containing a peripheral descriptor file and stores the contents of the file in a file in the pluginsFolder directory.
      private java.lang.String getFileData(java.lang.String fileName)
      This method returns a String containing the contents of the file with the specified fileName located in the /Website directory relative to the project's main folder.
      private java.lang.String getLoginPage()
      This method returns the contents of the login page (login.html) if a user account exists in the system and returns the page for creating a new account (newAccount.html) if a user account does not exist.
      void handle(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange)
      This method handles HTTP requests and responses for the user interface.
      private boolean validateSID(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange)
      This method validates the session ID of an HTTP request by parsing the cookie containing the session ID and calling the validateSID method in the mainController.

    • Field Detail

      • mainController

        private MainController mainController
        The main controller of the automation system whose requests are handled by this WebRequestHandler.

      • pluginsFolder

        private java.lang.String pluginsFolder
        A String that contains the path to the folder containing peripheral descriptors

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebRequestHandler

        public WebRequestHandler(MainController mainController)
        Create a new WebRequestHandler to handle user interface requests for the MainController of the automation system.
        Parameters:
        mainController - The main controller of the automation system whose requests are handled by this WebRequestHandler.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange)
            throws java.io.IOException
        This method handles HTTP requests and responses for the user interface. Many requests are delegated to the MainController class.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler
        Parameters:
        exchange - The HttpExchange containing the HTTP request to be handled and the HTTP response to be sent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getLoginPage

        private java.lang.String getLoginPage()
        This method returns the contents of the login page (login.html) if a user account exists in the system and returns the page for creating a new account (newAccount.html) if a user account does not exist.
        Returns:
        A String containing the HTML data for either the login page or the account creation page.

      • validateSID

        private boolean validateSID(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange)
        This method validates the session ID of an HTTP request by parsing the cookie containing the session ID and calling the validateSID method in the mainController.
        Parameters:
        exchange - The HttpExchange representing the HTTP request to be validated.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether the session ID is valid or not.
        See Also:
        MainController

      • destroySID

        private void destroySID(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange)
        This method destroys the session ID of an HTTP request by parsing the cookie containing the session ID and calling the destroySID method in the mainController.
        Parameters:
        exchange - The HttpExchange representing the HTTP request whose session ID should be destroyed.
        See Also:
        MainController

      • getFileData

        private java.lang.String getFileData(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method returns a String containing the contents of the file with the specified fileName located in the /Website directory relative to the project's main folder.

        If the file is not found, the response is "<h1>404 Not Found</h1>".

        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file whose content is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        A String containing the contents of the file.

      • downloadDescriptor

        private void downloadDescriptor(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange exchange)
        This method parses an HTTP request body containing a peripheral descriptor file and stores the contents of the file in a file in the pluginsFolder directory. The main controller is notified of the new descriptor by calling the newDescriptorAdded method in the mainController.
        Parameters:
        exchange - The HttpExchange representing the HTTP request containing the file to be downloaded.
        See Also:
        MainController
